First Off, thanks to everyone who replied to my questions, its good 
to see=
 a newbie-friendly discussion group :)  I have a lot of reading 
to do.

In=
 response to Derek's Question -

> 3. Can I setup SharpNeat to only evolve =
the topology of a network,
> > and determine the weights with traditional b=
ack prop ANN training?
> >
> Why would you necessarily want to do that?

I =
want to be able to seperate the weight evolution, because one of 
experimen=
ts I want to try is numeric prediction, and from reading 
around the intern=
et, it seems that solving this type of problem it is 
best to find the weig=
hts based on one set of training data, but 
validate the network on an seco=
nd set of data.  There may be other 
ways to do this with NEAT, while still=
 allowing NEAT to evolve the 
weights, but I don't know enough about the al=
gorithms yet - I have to 
play with it / read for a while.

Thanks Again!
M=
ike
